title: Cyclonic Storm “FENGAL” enters India, showers and strong winds continue across Sri Lanka
byline: The Meteorology Department says the Cyclonic Storm “FENGAL” over Southwest Bay of Bengal has entered India by crossed north Tamil Nadu -Puducherry coasts at 11.30 p.m. on 30th November 2024 as a cyclonic storm.

title: Gautam Adani breaks silence on US bribery indictment
byline: Adani Group founder Gautam Adani responded for the first time on Saturday to allegations by U.S. authorities that he was part of a $265 million bribery scheme, saying that his ports-to-power conglomerate was committed to world class regulatory compliance.

title: Three arrested while digging for treasure in Balathotaella
byline: Police have arrested three suspects while carrying out excavations in search of buried treasure.

title: CAA conducts special raids for festive season
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has implemented a series of special raids during the upcoming festive season, in a bid to safeguard consumers.

title: Adverse weather displaces over 143,000 people across 24 districts
byline: The ongoing adverse weather conditions from a deep depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal have left 143,726 people from 53,888 families displaced, seeking refuge in shelters and relatives’ homes, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) reported.

title: Special Commodity Levy on big onions reduced
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has reduced the Special Commodity Levy imposed on imported big onions to Rs. 10 per kilogram, to be in effect during the period from December 01 to December 31, 2024.

title: British citizen arrested over alleged terrorism financing in Colombo and Vanni
byline: Sri Lanka Police have arrested a 43-year-old British citizen of Sri Lankan origin for allegedly collecting and distributing funds for a terrorist group.

title: Another illegally assembled luxury vehicle discovered in Polgasowita
byline: Another luxury vehicle suspected to have been illegally assembled has been found at a garage in Polgasowita based on information received by Western Province police intelligence officers.

title: Importers confident of vehicle import resumption in February 2025
byline: The Vehicle Importers’ Association of Sri Lanka expressed confidence that the import of vehicles is expected to re-commence from February next year.

title: Uptick in AIDS cases reported in Sri Lanka – health officials
byline: World AIDS Day 2024 is observed today (Dec. 1) under the theme “Take the Rights Path: My Health, My Right!”

title: ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ stands alone amid fragmenting traditional political parties - Dilith Jayaweera
byline: While traditional political parties are being fragmented, the only emerging political movement left in the country is ‘Sarvajana Balaya’, says its leader, Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera.

title: Romania’s far right expected to make gains in parliamentary election
byline: Romanians vote in a parliamentary election on Sunday in which the far right is expected to gain from uncertainty over whether the shock result in a presidential election will stand.

title: Cyclone Fengal leaves parts of Southern India inundated, claims 2 lives
byline: Cyclone Fengal which triggered heavy rains across Sri Lanka, has killed at least 2 people in India and caused flooding in Tamil Nadu state and the Puducherry region after crossing India’s southern coast from the Bay of Bengal on Saturday.

title: Malaysia and Thailand flooding kills at least 12
byline: Huge flooding caused by heavy rain in Malaysia and neighbouring Thailand has killed at least 12 people, officials say.

title: New govt. not rushing decisions on SOE restructuring – President’s Economic Advisor
byline: Senior Economic Advisor to the President Duminda Hulangamuwa claims that the new government is encouraging the private sector to be at the forefront of economic development in the country.
